threat: If the user were tricked into opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could possibly exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird.
An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash.
An attacker could exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) or phishing attacks if scripting were enabled.
If a user had enabled scripting, an attacker could potentially exploit this to steal confidential data or execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird.
An attacker could potentially exploit this to execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird if scripting were enabled.
An attacker could potentially exploit this to execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird.
special:
The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:
After a standard system update you need to restart Thunderbird to make
all the necessary changes.
